ome.smuggler.core.io.crypto

Class CryptoKeyFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ome.smuggler.core.io.crypto.CryptoKeyFactory

  • public class CryptoKeyFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory methods for security Keys.

    • Method Detail

      • generateKey

        public static java.security.Key generateKey(CryptoAlgoSpec algo)
        Generates a security Key for the given algorithm.
        Parameters:
        algo - the algorithm to use.
        Returns:
        the key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.

      • exportKey

        public static void exportKey(java.security.Key key,
                             java.io.OutputStream out)
        Serialises a key into a given stream using Base64 encoding.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to serialise.
        out - the destination stream to write the data to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.

        The following checked exceptions are rethrown as unchecked (i.e. the exception is masked as a runtime exception and thrown as is without wrapping it in a RuntimeException):
        IOException if an error occurs while writing to the stream.

        See Also:
        importKey(InputStream)

      • exportKey

        public static java.lang.String exportKey(java.security.Key key)
        Serialises a key into a string using Base64 encoding. This method simply calls exportKey, capturing the output in a string.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to serialise.
        Returns:
        the serialised and Base64-encoded key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.

      • importKey

        public static java.security.Key importKey(java.io.InputStream in)
        De-serialises a key from a given Base64-encoded stream.
        Parameters:
        in - contains the key object as serialised by the export method.
        Returns:
        the key object read from the stream.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.

        The following checked exceptions are rethrown as unchecked (i.e. the exception is masked as a runtime exception and thrown as is without wrapping it in a RuntimeException):
        IOException if an error occurs while reading from the stream.
        ClassNotFoundException if an error occurs while instantiating the key object.

        See Also:
        exportKey(Key, OutputStream)

      • importKey

        public static java.security.Key importKey(java.lang.String encodedKey)
        De-serialises a key from a given Base64-encoded string.
        Parameters:
        encodedKey - contains the key object as serialised by the export method.
        Returns:
        the key object read from the stream.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.

        The following checked exceptions are rethrown as unchecked (i.e. the exception is masked as a runtime exception and thrown as is without wrapping it in a RuntimeException):
        IOException if an error occurs while reading from the string.
        ClassNotFoundException if an error occurs while instantiating the key object.

        See Also:
        exportKey(Key, OutputStream), exportNewKey(CryptoAlgoSpec)

      • exportNewKey

        public static java.lang.String exportNewKey(CryptoAlgoSpec algo)
        Generates a new key and serialises it using Base64 encoding. This method combines generateKey and exportKey, capturing the output in a string.
        Parameters:
        algo - the algorithm to use.
        Returns:
        the serialised and Base64-encoded key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
